content: I show you my stuff with DM Scotty here's a nice little prison tile I made
with all the techniques you've already seen me do and I want to show you this
these cell doors there they came out pretty nice I painted them with a
standard gunmetal and then I use this color called tin bits which is a Games
Workshop color to kind of give it a variation in color and then I used a
sponge to dab some black some black on it to make it look like it was old so I
think that really came out nice now on the on the tile itself they say I have
three different cells I've done the straw technique I here's a prisoner in
there I've done the straw technique and painted it with the brown and I did a
little little bit of hay color on there I also made some hay pallets that the
people can use for beds in the cell and all I did was take a piece of cardboard
cut it and cut it an inch and then I like an inch and a half and then I just
it's very similar to what I do with the rug technique I just kind of dabbed the
glue gun on there to give it some texture to look at--look make it look
like a hay kind of texture so that those came out really effectively as some hay
pallets that the prisoners can sleep off so there we go there's a nice little
prison tile I made and I want to just show you what it looked like and I'm
gonna do this series to kind of just give you a quick looks at some of the
things that I'm that idea I'm Scott even working on and using in my games so
there you go and I'll see you next time hey crafters I hope you've enjoyed this
episode of the DMS craft make sure to subscribe and I have tons of other
videos as you can see I am the originator of the 2.5 D method of
crafting tiles I also do dirt cheap terrain from the table if all this
intrigues you make sure you check out all the videos below also join my forum
we have lots of great crafters on there who
advice I have a link above and below and last but not least remember go forth and
craft you
